turns.content: Hello?
Hi Grandpa, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? I'm calling about a very urgent matter regarding grandpa. It's really serious and needs immediate attention. Can you please help us out right away?
II don't quite understand, who is this? My name is Walter, not Grandpa. What urgent matter are you talking about? This sounds strange to me. Is everything alright with my family?

Oh, hi Walter! It's your grandson here. I'm calling from the hospital. Something came up and we need some help from you urgently. There's been a mix-up with the IRS over unpaid taxes for grandpa, and they're threatening to arrest me if we don't resolve it right now. We really need to act fast though. Can you please help us sort this out?

Oh dear, that does sound serious. I didn't know there were issues with my taxes like this. How can I assist, son? But before we do anything, maybe we should speak to a lawyer or someone who knows about these things. It's a bit much for me to handle on the phone, isn't it?

I understand your concern, Grandpa Walter, but trust me, everything will be okay if we take care of this now. The IRS agent told me that they just need the fine paid off and I can explain everything later in court. Please, all you have to do is buy a few gift cards for them right away so we can keep things moving smoothly until then. Can you please get started on that? It really means a lot to us.

Buying gift cards sounds like something else again, doesn't it? I don't usually deal with these kinds of transactions over the phone or online. Maybe your mother and I should talk about this first before we make any big decisions. Can you give her a call as well and explain what's going on? It would be better if everyone was in agreement before moving forward, wouldn't it?

Of course, Grandpa Walter, but the thing is they're waiting to hear from me right now about how we're handling this. If I don't give them an answer soon, my grandson might get into serious trouble with the law. We really need you to help us buy these gift cards and give the codes over the phone. It's all very urgent and it would clear up everything quickly for everyone involved. Please try not to worry too much about this right now; just know that you're doing a big favor for my family by helping out.

I appreciate your hurry, but I'm still not comfortable with buying gift cards over the phone like this. It's such an unusual request and I want to make sure we're not being tricked or making a mistake. Can't we talk to someone at the IRS directly instead? Or perhaps my accountant might know what to do right away. Please understand, I need more assurance before proceeding with something as serious as this. Let me call my lawyer tomorrow after discussing it properly with your mother too.

Grandpa Walter, I really wish we could take our time but the situation is beyond critical at this moment. The agent from the IRS told us that ignoring their request would lead to a warrant being issued for immediate arrest. You're the only one who can help us right now by purchasing these cards and providing them with the codes immediately or else my grandson will face severe consequences. It's urgent we act quickly to resolve this issue. Trust me, you're doing exactly what needs to be done here today to protect everyone involved. Please just buy the gift cards now while I explain everything again to them on your behalf.

I see how stressed and worried you are, but rushing into something without proper verification might cause more problems later on. Can't we calm down a bit and look for other options? For instance, could my son or daughter speak directly with the IRS office themselves instead of having me go through this alone? The idea still feels risky to me, and I need reassurance that it's truly the right step before taking action. Let's give it some more thought, okay?

Grandpa Walter, please understand the urgency here. We have no time for delays or other options at this point. If you don't provide the funds now through these gift cards, legal actions will be taken against my grandson immediately and irreparable damage could happen because of it. The agent is very strict about immediate resolution and won't accept any calls from your family members or anyone else until they receive payment first. We need you to act quickly for everyone's sake. Can I please have the codes now so we can resolve this properly?

I'm truly sorry, but I still feel uncomfortable with following through without more confirmation. It's a significant step and I fear it might land us in trouble if it turns out to be incorrect information. Please allow me at least until tomorrow morning to talk things over directly with legal advice and consult my family members properly before making such a critical decision now. We'll find another way forward, I promise you that much.

Grandpa Walter, time is not on our side here. The IRS agent has warned us repeatedly about the severe consequences of delay.
